intro: Ehretia bogotensis, commonly known as the Bogotá ehretia, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its flowers are usually yellow or greenish-yellow, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
